House File 551 - Introduced


                                 HOUSE FILE 

                                 HOUSE FILE 
                                 HOUSE FILE                                  HOUSE FILE                                  BY  COMMITTEE ON
                                     TRANSPORTATION

                                 (SUCCESSOR TO HSB 75)

 A BILL FOR

  1 An Act establishing a motor vehicle insurance verification
  2    program, establishing fees, and including penalty and
  3    effective date provisions.
  4 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 1761HV (2) 87
    ns/nh

PAG LIN



  1  1    Section 1.  Section 321.11, subsection 3, Code 2017, is
  1  2 amended to read as follows:
  1  3    3.  Notwithstanding other provisions of this section to the
  1  4 contrary, the department shall not release personal information
  1  5 to a person, other than to an officer or employee of a law
  1  6 enforcement agency, an employee of a federal or state agency
  1  7 or political subdivision in the performance of the employee's
  1  8 official duties, a contract employee of the department of
  1  9 inspections and appeals in the conduct of an investigation, or
  1 10 a licensed private investigation agency or a licensed security
  1 11 service or a licensed employee of either, if the information is
  1 12 requested by the presentation of a registration plate number.

  2 15 department contracts under section 321B.3.

  2 17 defined in 18 U.S.C. {20.

  2 19 321.1.

  2 21 program created under this chapter.

  2 23 service established by insurers through the internet, the
  2 24 world wide web, or a similar proprietary or common carrier
  2 25 electronic system that complies with the specifications and
  2 26 standards of the insurance industry committee on motor vehicle
  2 27 administration and that is available twenty=four hours per
  2 28 day, seven days per week, subject to reasonable allowances for
  2 29 scheduled maintenance or temporary system failures.

  2 30    Sec. 6.    2 30    Sec. 6.    2 31 verification program == advisory council.
  2 32    1.  A motor vehicle insurance verification program is
  2 33 created within the department to be administered by the
  2 34 department.  The purposes of the program include all of the
  2 35 following:
  3  1    a.  To establish a motor vehicle insurance verification
  3  2 database to verify compliance with the requirements of section
  3  3 321.20B.
  3  4    b.  To assist in reducing the number of uninsured motor
  3  5 vehicles on the highways of the state.
  3  6    c.  To assist in increasing compliance with motor vehicle
  3  7 registration requirements and for other law enforcement
  3  8 purposes.
  3  9    d.  To assist in protecting the bona fide security interests
  3 10 of financial institutions in motor vehicles.
  3 11    2.  a.  The department shall establish an advisory council,
  3 12 chaired by the director of the department or a representative
  3 13 of the department appointed by the director, consisting of
  3 14 six members including the director of the department or the
  3 15 representative of the department appointed by the director,
  3 16 a representative of the department of public safety, an
  3 17 insurance company representative appointed by the commissioner
  3 18 of insurance, an insurance agent appointed by the commissioner
  3 19 of insurance, a representative of a trade association of
  3 20 property and casualty insurers appointed by the commissioner
  3 21 of insurance, and a representative of a vendor with experience
  3 22 implementing real=time internet services models and databases
  3 23 similar to the database created under this chapter appointed by
  3 24 the director of the department.
  3 25    b.  The advisory council shall do all of the following:
  3 26    (1)  Make recommendations to the department on the best
  3 27 methods and practices for implementing a real=time internet
  3 28 services model for insurance verification.
  3 29    (2)  Assist in the development of a guide for insurers
  3 30 detailing the data fields and other information necessary for
  3 31 compliance with this chapter.
  3 32    (3)  Provide an annual report to the department detailing the
  3 33 improvements and implementation efforts relating to insurance
  3 34 verification in other states for consideration in improving
  3 35 compliance and operations in this state.
  4  1    3.  Following the competitive bidding procedures as provided
  4  2 in chapter 8A, subchapter III, the department shall contract
  4  3 with a third party to act as the department's designated agent
  4  4 for administration of this chapter for a period of four years.
  4  5 For the period of the contract, the designated agent shall
  4  6 establish and maintain a computer database containing the
  4  7 following information:
  4  8    a.  Information provided by insurers under section 321B.5.
  4  9    b.  Information provided by the department under subsection
  4 10 6.
  4 11    c.  Information obtained using a real=time internet services
  4 12 model.
  4 13    d.  Any other information provided by the department pursuant
  4 14 to this chapter.
  4 15    4.  The database shall be developed and maintained, and
  4 16 access to a real=time internet services model shall be
  4 17 provided, in accordance with guidelines established by the
  4 18 department by rule to allow authorized state and local law
  4 19 enforcement agencies and financial institutions to efficiently
  4 20 access the records of the database and real=time internet
  4 21 services model, including reports useful for the implementation
  4 22 of this chapter, twenty=four hours per day, seven days
  4 23 per week, subject to reasonable allowances for scheduled
  4 24 maintenance or temporary system failures.
  4 25    a.  Database reports shall be in a form and contain
  4 26 information approved by the department.
  4 27    b.  Database reports may be made available through the
  4 28 department's internet site or through other electronic media
  4 29 if the department determines that sufficient security is
  4 30 provided to ensure compliance with the provisions of this
  4 31 chapter regarding limitations on disclosure of information in
  4 32 the database.
  4 33    c.  The department shall consult with the chief information
  4 34 officer appointed under section 8B.2 for the purpose of
  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.
  5  1    5.  At least twice monthly, the designated agent shall do the
  5  2 following, using information provided by the department:
  5  3    a.  Update the database with motor vehicle insurance
  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.
  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.
  5 18    7.  The department shall adopt rules in accordance with
  5 19 chapter 17A establishing procedures for the use of the
  5 20 department's motor vehicle database for the purposes of
  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.
  5 22    8.  a.  The designated agent shall archive database files at
  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.
  5 24    b.  The department shall audit the program at least annually.
  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.
  5 27    (2)  The accuracy of the designated agent's matching of
  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.

  3 16 a representative of the department of public safety, an
  3 17 insurance company representative appointed by the commissioner
  3 18 of insurance, an insurance agent appointed by the commissioner
  3 19 of insurance, a representative of a trade association of
  3 20 property and casualty insurers appointed by the commissioner
  3 21 of insurance, and a representative of a vendor with experience
  3 22 implementing real=time internet services models and databases
  3 23 similar to the database created under this chapter appointed by
  3 24 the director of the department.
  3 25    b.  The advisory council shall do all of the following:
  3 26    (1)  Make recommendations to the department on the best
  3 27 methods and practices for implementing a real=time internet
  3 28 services model for insurance verification.
  3 29    (2)  Assist in the development of a guide for insurers
  3 30 detailing the data fields and other information necessary for
  3 31 compliance with this chapter.
  3 32    (3)  Provide an annual report to the department detailing the
  3 33 improvements and implementation efforts relating to insurance
  3 34 verification in other states for consideration in improving
  3 35 compliance and operations in this state.
  4  1    3.  Following the competitive bidding procedures as provided
  4  2 in chapter 8A, subchapter III, the department shall contract
  4  3 with a third party to act as the department's designated agent
  4  4 for administration of this chapter for a period of four years.
  4  5 For the period of the contract, the designated agent shall
  4  6 establish and maintain a computer database containing the
  4  7 following information:
  4  8    a.  Information provided by insurers under section 321B.5.
  4  9    b.  Information provided by the department under subsection
  4 10 6.
  4 11    c.  Information obtained using a real=time internet services
  4 12 model.
  4 13    d.  Any other information provided by the department pursuant
  4 14 to this chapter.
  4 15    4.  The database shall be developed and maintained, and
  4 16 access to a real=time internet services model shall be
  4 17 provided, in accordance with guidelines established by the
  4 18 department by rule to allow authorized state and local law
  4 19 enforcement agencies and financial institutions to efficiently
  4 20 access the records of the database and real=time internet
  4 21 services model, including reports useful for the implementation
  4 22 of this chapter, twenty=four hours per day, seven days
  4 23 per week, subject to reasonable allowances for scheduled
  4 24 maintenance or temporary system failures.
  4 25    a.  Database reports shall be in a form and contain
  4 26 information approved by the department.
  4 27    b.  Database reports may be made available through the
  4 28 department's internet site or through other electronic media
  4 29 if the department determines that sufficient security is
  4 30 provided to ensure compliance with the provisions of this
  4 31 chapter regarding limitations on disclosure of information in
  4 32 the database.
  4 33    c.  The department shall consult with the chief information
  4 34 officer appointed under section 8B.2 for the purpose of
  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.
  5  1    5.  At least twice monthly, the designated agent shall do the
  5  2 following, using information provided by the department:
  5  3    a.  Update the database with motor vehicle insurance
  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.
  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.
  5 18    7.  The department shall adopt rules in accordance with
  5 19 chapter 17A establishing procedures for the use of the
  5 20 department's motor vehicle database for the purposes of
  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.
  5 22    8.  a.  The designated agent shall archive database files at
  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.
  5 24    b.  The department shall audit the program at least annually.
  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.
  5 27    (2)  The accuracy of the designated agent's matching of
  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.
  5 29    Sec. 7.    2 35 following:
  3  1    a.  To establish a motor vehicle insurance verification

  3  3 321.20B.
  3  4    b.  To assist in reducing the number of uninsured motor
  3  5 vehicles on the highways of the state.
  3  6    c.  To assist in increasing compliance with motor vehicle
  3  7 registration requirements and for other law enforcement
  3  8 purposes.
  3  9    d.  To assist in protecting the bona fide security interests
  3 10 of financial institutions in motor vehicles.

  5  3    a.  Update the database with motor vehicle insurance
  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.
  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.
  5 18    7.  The department shall adopt rules in accordance with
  5 19 chapter 17A establishing procedures for the use of the
  5 20 department's motor vehicle database for the purposes of
  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.
  5 22    8.  a.  The designated agent shall archive database files at
  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.
  5 24    b.  The department shall audit the program at least annually.
  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.
  5 27    (2)  The accuracy of the designated agent's matching of
  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.
  5 29    Sec. 7.    3  5 vehicles on the highways of the state.
  3  6    c.  To assist in increasing compliance with motor vehicle
  3  7 registration requirements and for other law enforcement
  3  8 purposes.
  3  9    d.  To assist in protecting the bona fide security interests
  3 10 of financial institutions in motor vehicles.
  3 11    2.  a.  The department shall establish an advisory council,
  3 12 chaired by the director of the department or a representative
  3 13 of the department appointed by the director, consisting of
  3 14 six members including the director of the department or the
  3 15 representative of the department appointed by the director,
  3 16 a representative of the department of public safety, an
  3 17 insurance company representative appointed by the commissioner
  3 18 of insurance, an insurance agent appointed by the commissioner
  3 19 of insurance, a representative of a trade association of
  3 20 property and casualty insurers appointed by the commissioner
  3 21 of insurance, and a representative of a vendor with experience
  3 22 implementing real=time internet services models and databases
  3 23 similar to the database created under this chapter appointed by
  3 24 the director of the department.
  3 25    b.  The advisory council shall do all of the following:
  3 26    (1)  Make recommendations to the department on the best
  3 27 methods and practices for implementing a real=time internet
  3 28 services model for insurance verification.
  3 29    (2)  Assist in the development of a guide for insurers
  3 30 detailing the data fields and other information necessary for
  3 31 compliance with this chapter.
  3 32    (3)  Provide an annual report to the department detailing the
  3 33 improvements and implementation efforts relating to insurance
  3 34 verification in other states for consideration in improving
  3 35 compliance and operations in this state.
  4  1    3.  Following the competitive bidding procedures as provided
  4  2 in chapter 8A, subchapter III, the department shall contract
  4  3 with a third party to act as the department's designated agent
  4  4 for administration of this chapter for a period of four years.
  4  5 For the period of the contract, the designated agent shall
  4  6 establish and maintain a computer database containing the
  4  7 following information:
  4  8    a.  Information provided by insurers under section 321B.5.
  4  9    b.  Information provided by the department under subsection
  4 10 6.
  4 11    c.  Information obtained using a real=time internet services
  4 12 model.
  4 13    d.  Any other information provided by the department pursuant
  4 14 to this chapter.
  4 15    4.  The database shall be developed and maintained, and
  4 16 access to a real=time internet services model shall be
  4 17 provided, in accordance with guidelines established by the
  4 18 department by rule to allow authorized state and local law
  4 19 enforcement agencies and financial institutions to efficiently
  4 20 access the records of the database and real=time internet
  4 21 services model, including reports useful for the implementation
  4 22 of this chapter, twenty=four hours per day, seven days
  4 23 per week, subject to reasonable allowances for scheduled
  4 24 maintenance or temporary system failures.
  4 25    a.  Database reports shall be in a form and contain
  4 26 information approved by the department.
  4 27    b.  Database reports may be made available through the
  4 28 department's internet site or through other electronic media
  4 29 if the department determines that sufficient security is
  4 30 provided to ensure compliance with the provisions of this
  4 31 chapter regarding limitations on disclosure of information in
  4 32 the database.
  4 33    c.  The department shall consult with the chief information
  4 34 officer appointed under section 8B.2 for the purpose of
  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.

  4 28 department's internet site or through other electronic media
  4 29 if the department determines that sufficient security is
  4 30 provided to ensure compliance with the provisions of this
  4 31 chapter regarding limitations on disclosure of information in
  4 32 the database.
  4 33    c.  The department shall consult with the chief information
  4 34 officer appointed under section 8B.2 for the purpose of
  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.
  5  1    5.  At least twice monthly, the designated agent shall do the
  5  2 following, using information provided by the department:
  5  3    a.  Update the database with motor vehicle insurance
  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.
  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.
  5 18    7.  The department shall adopt rules in accordance with
  5 19 chapter 17A establishing procedures for the use of the
  5 20 department's motor vehicle database for the purposes of
  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.
  5 22    8.  a.  The designated agent shall archive database files at
  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.
  5 24    b.  The department shall audit the program at least annually.
  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.
  5 27    (2)  The accuracy of the designated agent's matching of
  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.
  5 29    Sec. 7.    3 11    2.  a.  The department shall establish an advisory council,
  3 12 chaired by the director of the department or a representative
  3 13 of the department appointed by the director, consisting of
  3 14 six members including the director of the department or the
  3 15 representative of the department appointed by the director,
  3 16 a representative of the department of public safety, an
  3 17 insurance company representative appointed by the commissioner
  3 18 of insurance, an insurance agent appointed by the commissioner
  3 19 of insurance, a representative of a trade association of
  3 20 property and casualty insurers appointed by the commissioner
  3 21 of insurance, and a representative of a vendor with experience
  3 22 implementing real=time internet services models and databases
  3 23 similar to the database created under this chapter appointed by
  3 24 the director of the department.
  3 25    b.  The advisory council shall do all of the following:
  3 26    (1)  Make recommendations to the department on the best
  3 27 methods and practices for implementing a real=time internet
  3 28 services model for insurance verification.
  3 29    (2)  Assist in the development of a guide for insurers
  3 30 detailing the data fields and other information necessary for
  3 31 compliance with this chapter.
  3 32    (3)  Provide an annual report to the department detailing the
  3 33 improvements and implementation efforts relating to insurance
  3 34 verification in other states for consideration in improving
  3 35 compliance and operations in this state.

  4 12 model.

  4 14 to this chapter.

  4 20 access the records of the database and real=time internet
  4 21 services model, including reports useful for the implementation
  4 22 of this chapter, twenty=four hours per day, seven days
  4 23 per week, subject to reasonable allowances for scheduled

  5 20 department's motor vehicle database for the purposes of
  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.
  5 22    8.  a.  The designated agent shall archive database files at
  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.
  5 24    b.  The department shall audit the program at least annually.
  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.
  5 27    (2)  The accuracy of the designated agent's matching of
  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.
  5 29    Sec. 7.    3 17 insurance company representative appointed by the commissioner
  3 18 of insurance, an insurance agent appointed by the commissioner
  3 19 of insurance, a representative of a trade association of
  3 20 property and casualty insurers appointed by the commissioner
  3 21 of insurance, and a representative of a vendor with experience
  3 22 implementing real=time internet services models and databases
  3 23 similar to the database created under this chapter appointed by
  3 24 the director of the department.
  3 25    b.  The advisory council shall do all of the following:
  3 26    (1)  Make recommendations to the department on the best
  3 27 methods and practices for implementing a real=time internet
  3 28 services model for insurance verification.
  3 29    (2)  Assist in the development of a guide for insurers
  3 30 detailing the data fields and other information necessary for
  3 31 compliance with this chapter.
  3 32    (3)  Provide an annual report to the department detailing the
  3 33 improvements and implementation efforts relating to insurance
  3 34 verification in other states for consideration in improving
  3 35 compliance and operations in this state.
  4  1    3.  Following the competitive bidding procedures as provided
  4  2 in chapter 8A, subchapter III, the department shall contract
  4  3 with a third party to act as the department's designated agent
  4  4 for administration of this chapter for a period of four years.
  4  5 For the period of the contract, the designated agent shall
  4  6 establish and maintain a computer database containing the
  4  7 following information:
  4  8    a.  Information provided by insurers under section 321B.5.
  4  9    b.  Information provided by the department under subsection
  4 10 6.
  4 11    c.  Information obtained using a real=time internet services
  4 12 model.
  4 13    d.  Any other information provided by the department pursuant
  4 14 to this chapter.
  4 15    4.  The database shall be developed and maintained, and
  4 16 access to a real=time internet services model shall be
  4 17 provided, in accordance with guidelines established by the
  4 18 department by rule to allow authorized state and local law
  4 19 enforcement agencies and financial institutions to efficiently
  4 20 access the records of the database and real=time internet
  4 21 services model, including reports useful for the implementation
  4 22 of this chapter, twenty=four hours per day, seven days
  4 23 per week, subject to reasonable allowances for scheduled
  4 24 maintenance or temporary system failures.
  4 25    a.  Database reports shall be in a form and contain
  4 26 information approved by the department.
  4 27    b.  Database reports may be made available through the
  4 28 department's internet site or through other electronic media
  4 29 if the department determines that sufficient security is
  4 30 provided to ensure compliance with the provisions of this
  4 31 chapter regarding limitations on disclosure of information in
  4 32 the database.
  4 33    c.  The department shall consult with the chief information
  4 34 officer appointed under section 8B.2 for the purpose of
  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.
  5  1    5.  At least twice monthly, the designated agent shall do the
  5  2 following, using information provided by the department:
  5  3    a.  Update the database with motor vehicle insurance
  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.
  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.

  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.

  5 19 chapter 17A establishing procedures for the use of the

  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.

  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.

  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.

  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.

  4  5 For the period of the contract, the designated agent shall
  4  6 establish and maintain a computer database containing the
  4  7 following information:
  4  8    a.  Information provided by insurers under section 321B.5.
  4  9    b.  Information provided by the department under subsection
  4 10 6.
  4 11    c.  Information obtained using a real=time internet services
  4 12 model.
  4 13    d.  Any other information provided by the department pursuant
  4 14 to this chapter.
  4 15    4.  The database shall be developed and maintained, and
  4 16 access to a real=time internet services model shall be
  4 17 provided, in accordance with guidelines established by the
  4 18 department by rule to allow authorized state and local law
  4 19 enforcement agencies and financial institutions to efficiently
  4 20 access the records of the database and real=time internet
  4 21 services model, including reports useful for the implementation
  4 22 of this chapter, twenty=four hours per day, seven days
  4 23 per week, subject to reasonable allowances for scheduled
  4 24 maintenance or temporary system failures.
  4 25    a.  Database reports shall be in a form and contain
  4 26 information approved by the department.
  4 27    b.  Database reports may be made available through the
  4 28 department's internet site or through other electronic media
  4 29 if the department determines that sufficient security is
  4 30 provided to ensure compliance with the provisions of this
  4 31 chapter regarding limitations on disclosure of information in
  4 32 the database.
  4 33    c.  The department shall consult with the chief information
  4 34 officer appointed under section 8B.2 for the purpose of
  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.
  5  1    5.  At least twice monthly, the designated agent shall do the
  5  2 following, using information provided by the department:
  5  3    a.  Update the database with motor vehicle insurance
  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.
  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.
  5 18    7.  The department shall adopt rules in accordance with
  5 19 chapter 17A establishing procedures for the use of the
  5 20 department's motor vehicle database for the purposes of
  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.
  5 22    8.  a.  The designated agent shall archive database files at
  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.
  5 24    b.  The department shall audit the program at least annually.
  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.
  5 27    (2)  The accuracy of the designated agent's matching of
  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.
  5 29    Sec. 7.    3 32    (3)  Provide an annual report to the department detailing the
  3 33 improvements and implementation efforts relating to insurance
  3 34 verification in other states for consideration in improving
  3 35 compliance and operations in this state.

  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.
  5  1    5.  At least twice monthly, the designated agent shall do the
  5  2 following, using information provided by the department:
  5  3    a.  Update the database with motor vehicle insurance
  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.
  5  6    b.  Compare all current motor vehicle registrations against
  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.
  5 13    6.  On or before the seventh day of each calendar month, the
  5 14 department shall provide the designated agent with the make,
  5 15 model, year, and vehicle identification number of each vehicle
  5 16 in the department's motor vehicle database, and the name and
  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.
  5 18    7.  The department shall adopt rules in accordance with
  5 19 chapter 17A establishing procedures for the use of the
  5 20 department's motor vehicle database for the purposes of
  5 21 administering and enforcing this chapter.
  5 22    8.  a.  The designated agent shall archive database files at
  5 23 least semiannually for auditing purposes.
  5 24    b.  The department shall audit the program at least annually.
  5 25 The audit shall include verification of:
  5 26    (1)  Billings made by the designated agent.
  5 27    (2)  The accuracy of the designated agent's matching of
  5 28 vehicle registration records with insurance data.

  4 21 services model, including reports useful for the implementation
  4 22 of this chapter, twenty=four hours per day, seven days

  4 28 department's internet site or through other electronic media
  4 29 if the department determines that sufficient security is
  4 30 provided to ensure compliance with the provisions of this
  4 31 chapter regarding limitations on disclosure of information in
  4 32 the database.

  4 34 officer appointed under section 8B.2 for the purpose of
  4 35 developing network security requirements for the database.

  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.

  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.

  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.

  5  2 following, using information provided by the department:

  5  4 information provided by insurers in accordance with section
  5  5 321B.5.

  5  7 the database. If records in the database indicate that a
  5  8 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's
  5  9 policy of liability insurance, the designated agent shall
  5 10 use a real=time internet services model to determine if the
  5 11 registered motor vehicle is covered under an owner's policy of
  5 12 liability insurance.

  5 17 address of each person listed on each vehicle's registration.

  5 29    Sec. 7.    5 29    Sec. 7.    5 30 responsibility requirements ==== penalty.
  5 31    1.  If records in the database and the real=time internet
  5 32 services model used by the designated agent indicate that a
  5 33 registered motor vehicle is not covered under an owner's policy
  5 34 of liability insurance for three consecutive months, at the
  5 35 direction of the department the designated agent shall provide
  6  1 notice by first=class mail to the owner of the motor vehicle
  6  2 that the owner has fifteen days from the date the notice was
  6  3 mailed to provide one of the following:
  6  4    a.  Proof of financial liability coverage as defined in
  6  5 section 321.1, subsection 24B.
  6  6    b.  Proof that the owner is exempt from the requirement to
  6  7 maintain proof of financial liability coverage under section
  6  8 321.20B.
  6  9    2.  If, after fifteen days, the owner of the motor vehicle
  6 10 fails to provide satisfactory proof of financial liability
  6 11 coverage, the designated agent shall provide a second notice
  6 12 by first=class mail to the owner of the motor vehicle allowing
  6 13 the owner an additional fifteen days from the date the second
  6 14 notice was mailed to provide the information requested under
  6 15 subsection 1.
  6 16    3.  a.  The designated agent shall update the database
  6 17 regarding each notice sent to a motor vehicle owner under
  6 18 subsections 1 and 2, indicating the information provided by the
  6 19 motor vehicle owner or the owner's failure to provide proof of
  6 20 financial liability coverage, as applicable.
  6 21    b.  If the owner of a motor vehicle provides proof to the
  6 22 department or the designated agent that the owner's motor
  6 23 vehicle is covered by an acceptable form of financial liability
  6 24 coverage described in section 321.1, subsection 24B, paragraph
  6 25 "b", "c", or "d", the information shall be recorded in the
  6 26 database.
  6 27    c.  If the designated agent determines the motor vehicle
  6 28 is appropriately insured using a real=time internet services
  6 29 model, the information shall be recorded in the database.
  6 30    4.  a.  If the owner of a motor vehicle fails to provide
  6 31 proof of financial liability coverage following receipt of the
  6 32 second notice under subsection 2, the designated agent shall
  6 33 notify the department, and the department shall revoke the
  6 34 registration of the motor vehicle.
  6 35    b.  The department shall provide to the owner of the motor
  7  1 vehicle appropriate notice of the revocation, order the owner
  7  2 to surrender the registration plates and registration receipt
  7  3 for the vehicle to the county treasurer, advise the owner of
  7  4 the legal consequences of operating a vehicle with revoked
  7  5 registration and without financial liability coverage, and
  7  6 instruct the owner on how to reinstate the vehicle registration
  7  7 once the owner has obtained financial liability coverage for
  7  8 the vehicle.
  7  9    5.  a.  A person shall not provide a false or fraudulent
  7 10 statement to the department or the department's designated
  7 11 agent in regard to proceedings under this chapter.
  7 12    b.  In addition to any other penalties, a person who violates
  7 13 paragraph "a" is guilty of a simple misdemeanor.
  7 14    6.  A revocation of registration under this chapter is in
  7 15 addition to any other penalty imposed by law.  This chapter
  7 16 does not affect other actions or penalties that may be taken or
  7 17 imposed for a violation of section 321.20B or other law.
  7 18    7.  a.  A registration that has been revoked under this
  7 19 section shall not be reinstated and a new registration shall
  7 20 not be issued to the holder of the revoked registration until
  7 21 the person does all of the following:
  7 22    (1)  Pays to the department an administrative reinstatement
  7 23 fee of one hundred dollars, in addition to any other penalty
  7 24 imposed by law.
  7 25    (2)  Complies with the requirements of section 321.20B and
  7 26 this chapter.
  7 27    b.  Reinstatement fees collected under this subsection shall
  7 28 be retained by the department as repayment receipts as defined
  7 29 in section 8.2 and shall be used exclusively to offset the
  7 30 costs of administering the program, including payments made by
  7 31 the department to the department's designated agent.

  6  2 that the owner has fifteen days from the date the notice was
  6  3 mailed to provide one of the following:
  6  4    a.  Proof of financial liability coverage as defined in
  6  5 section 321.1, subsection 24B.
  6  6    b.  Proof that the owner is exempt from the requirement to
  6  7 maintain proof of financial liability coverage under section
  6  8 321.20B.
  6  9    2.  If, after fifteen days, the owner of the motor vehicle
  6 10 fails to provide satisfactory proof of financial liability
  6 11 coverage, the designated agent shall provide a second notice
  6 12 by first=class mail to the owner of the motor vehicle allowing
  6 13 the owner an additional fifteen days from the date the second
  6 14 notice was mailed to provide the information requested under
  6 15 subsection 1.
  6 16    3.  a.  The designated agent shall update the database
  6 17 regarding each notice sent to a motor vehicle owner under
  6 18 subsections 1 and 2, indicating the information provided by the
  6 19 motor vehicle owner or the owner's failure to provide proof of
  6 20 financial liability coverage, as applicable.
  6 21    b.  If the owner of a motor vehicle provides proof to the
  6 22 department or the designated agent that the owner's motor
  6 23 vehicle is covered by an acceptable form of financial liability
  6 24 coverage described in section 321.1, subsection 24B, paragraph
  6 25 "b", "c", or "d", the information shall be recorded in the
  6 26 database.
  6 27    c.  If the designated agent determines the motor vehicle
  6 28 is appropriately insured using a real=time internet services
  6 29 model, the information shall be recorded in the database.
  6 30    4.  a.  If the owner of a motor vehicle fails to provide
  6 31 proof of financial liability coverage following receipt of the
  6 32 second notice under subsection 2, the designated agent shall
  6 33 notify the department, and the department shall revoke the
  6 34 registration of the motor vehicle.
  6 35    b.  The department shall provide to the owner of the motor
  7  1 vehicle appropriate notice of the revocation, order the owner
  7  2 to surrender the registration plates and registration receipt
  7  3 for the vehicle to the county treasurer, advise the owner of
  7  4 the legal consequences of operating a vehicle with revoked
  7  5 registration and without financial liability coverage, and
  7  6 instruct the owner on how to reinstate the vehicle registration
  7  7 once the owner has obtained financial liability coverage for
  7  8 the vehicle.
  7  9    5.  a.  A person shall not provide a false or fraudulent
  7 10 statement to the department or the department's designated
  7 11 agent in regard to proceedings under this chapter.
  7 12    b.  In addition to any other penalties, a person who violates
  7 13 paragraph "a" is guilty of a simple misdemeanor.
  7 14    6.  A revocation of registration under this chapter is in
  7 15 addition to any other penalty imposed by law.  This chapter
  7 16 does not affect other actions or penalties that may be taken or
  7 17 imposed for a violation of section 321.20B or other law.

  7 20 not be issued to the holder of the revoked registration until
  7 21 the person does all of the following:
  7 22    (1)  Pays to the department an administrative reinstatement
  7 23 fee of one hundred dollars, in addition to any other penalty
  7 24 imposed by law.
  7 25    (2)  Complies with the requirements of section 321.20B and
  7 26 this chapter.
  7 27    b.  Reinstatement fees collected under this subsection shall
  7 28 be retained by the department as repayment receipts as defined
  7 29 in section 8.2 and shall be used exclusively to offset the
  7 30 costs of administering the program, including payments made by
  7 31 the department to the department's designated agent.

  6 18 subsections 1 and 2, indicating the information provided by the

  6 20 financial liability coverage, as applicable.

  6 23 vehicle is covered by an acceptable form of financial liability

  6 25 "b", "c", or "d", the information shall be recorded in the
  6 26 database.

  6 28 is appropriately insured using a real=time internet services
  6 29 model, the information shall be recorded in the database.

  7 11 agent in regard to proceedings under this chapter.
  7 12    b.  In addition to any other penalties, a person who violates
  7 13 paragraph "a" is guilty of a simple misdemeanor.
  7 14    6.  A revocation of registration under this chapter is in
  7 15 addition to any other penalty imposed by law.  This chapter
  7 16 does not affect other actions or penalties that may be taken or
  7 17 imposed for a violation of section 321.20B or other law.

  7 19 section shall not be reinstated and a new registration shall
  7 20 not be issued to the holder of the revoked registration until
  7 21 the person does all of the following:
  7 22    (1)  Pays to the department an administrative reinstatement
  7 23 fee of one hundred dollars, in addition to any other penalty
  7 24 imposed by law.
  7 25    (2)  Complies with the requirements of section 321.20B and
  7 26 this chapter.

  7 28 be retained by the department as repayment receipts as defined
  7 29 in section 8.2 and shall be used exclusively to offset the
  7 30 costs of administering the program, including payments made by
  7 31 the department to the department's designated agent.

  7 32    Sec. 8.    7 32    Sec. 8.    7 33 reporting ==== penalty.
  7 34    1.  a.  Except as provided in paragraph "b", each insurer
  7 35 that issues a policy to a motor vehicle owner in this state
  8  1 that includes motor vehicle liability coverage, uninsured
  8  2 motorist coverage, underinsured motorist coverage, or
  8  3 personal injury coverage shall, on or before the seventh
  8  4 and twenty=first days of each calendar month, submit to the
  8  5 department's designated agent a record of each motor vehicle
  8  6 insurance policy that was issued by the insurer and in effect
  8  7 for a vehicle registered or garaged in this state as of the
  8  8 date of the previous submission.
  8  9    b.  An insurer is not required to provide a record of a motor
  8 10 vehicle insurance policy under paragraph "a" if the policy
  8 11 covers a vehicle that is registered under chapter 326.
  8 12    c.  This subsection does not preclude more frequent
  8 13 reporting.
  8 14    2.  A record provided by an insurer under subsection 1,
  8 15 paragraph "a", shall include all of the following:
  8 16    a.  The name, date of birth, and driver's license number, if
  8 17 the insured provides a driver's license number to the insurer,
  8 18 of each insured owner or operator, and the address of the named
  8 19 insured.
  8 20    b.  The make, year, and vehicle identification number of each
  8 21 insured vehicle.
  8 22    c.  The policy number and effective date of each policy.
  8 23    3.  An insurer shall provide the information required under
  8 24 this section via electronic means or via another means the
  8 25 designated agent agrees to accept.
  8 26    4.  a.  The department may assess a civil penalty of not more
  8 27 than two hundred fifty dollars for each day an insurer fails to
  8 28 comply with this section.
  8 29    b.  If an insurer shows that the failure to comply with this
  8 30 section was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
  8 31 neglect, the department may waive the civil penalty.
  8 32    c.  An insurer that discloses records to the department's
  8 33 designated agent in a reasonable, good=faith effort to comply
  8 34 with the requirements of this section shall not be subject to a
  8 35 civil penalty under paragraph "a".

  8 28 comply with this section.
  8 29    b.  If an insurer shows that the failure to comply with this
  8 30 section was inadvertent, accidental, or the result of excusable
  8 31 neglect, the department may waive the civil penalty.
  8 32    c.  An insurer that discloses records to the department's
  8 33 designated agent in a reasonable, good=faith effort to comply
  8 34 with the requirements of this section shall not be subject to a
  8 35 civil penalty under paragraph "a".

  9  1    Sec. 9.    9  1    Sec. 9.    9  2 information ==== penalty.
  9  3    1.  Information provided to the designated agent and
  9  4 information contained in the database under this chapter are
  9  5 confidential and subject to the provisions and penalties of 18
  9  6 U.S.C. {2721.  Such information may not be disclosed, except
  9  7 as follows:
  9  8    a.  For the purpose of investigating, litigating, or
  9  9 enforcing the financial liability coverage requirements
  9 10 of section 321.20B, the designated agent shall provide an
  9 11 electronic record to a state or local government agency or
  9 12 court verifying motor vehicle financial liability coverage
  9 13 information.
  9 14    b.  For the purpose of investigating, litigating, or
  9 15 enforcing the financial liability coverage requirements of
  9 16 section 321.20B, the designated agent shall, upon request,
  9 17 issue to any state or local government agency or court a
  9 18 certificate documenting motor vehicle financial liability
  9 19 coverage, according to the database, of a specific individual
  9 20 or motor vehicle for the time period designated by the
  9 21 government agency or court.
  9 22    c.  Upon request, the department or its designated agent
  9 23 shall disclose whether an individual is covered under a motor
  9 24 vehicle insurance policy, proof of the insurance coverage
  9 25 policy, and the insurance company name to:
  9 26    (1)  The individual or, if the individual is deceased,
  9 27 any person who is an interested party in the estate of the
  9 28 individual as provided under chapter 633.
  9 29    (2)  The parent or legal guardian of the individual if the
  9 30 individual is an unemancipated minor.
  9 31    (3)  The legal guardian of the individual if the individual
  9 32 is legally incapacitated.
  9 33    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  9 34    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the
  9 35 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
 10  1 request is made.
 10  2    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
 10  3 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
 10  4 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
 10  5 to access to accident reports.
 10  6    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
 10  7 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
 10  8 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
 10  9 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
 10 10 enforcement agencies.
 10 11    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
 10 12 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
 10 13 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
 10 14 information contained in the database.
 10 15    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
 10 16 of the program.
 10 17    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
 10 18 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
 10 19 interest in a motor vehicle.
 10 20    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
 10 21 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
 10 22 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
 10 23 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
 10 24    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
 10 25 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
 10 26    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
 10 27 another electronic medium if the department determines that
 10 28 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
 10 29 section.
 10 30    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
 10 31 fee established by the department for each of the following:
 10 32    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
 10 33 delivery of a certified copy.
 10 34    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
 10 35 another electronic medium.
 11  1    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
 11  2 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
 11  3    3.  The designated agent or any other person who knowingly
 11  4 releases or discloses information from the database for a
 11  5 purpose other than those authorized in this section or to a
 11  6 person who is not entitled to such information is guilty of a
 11  7 class "D" felony.
 11  8    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
 11  9 shall be liable to any person for gathering, managing, or
 11 10 using the information in the database in compliance with this
 11 11 chapter.
 11 12    5.  The designated agent shall be responsible for
 11 13 maintaining and securing the information in the database
 11 14 provided by the department and insurers under sections 321B.3
 11 15 and 321B.5.
 11 16    6.  An insurer acting in compliance with this chapter shall
 11 17 not be liable to any person for the disclosure of information
 11 18 supplied to the department or designated agent. The designated
 11 19 agent shall indemnify an insurer against any loss arising from
 11 20 the disclosure of information supplied to the department or
 11 21 designated agent, provided the insurer supplied the information
 11 22 to the department or designated agent in a manner that complies
 11 23 with this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to this chapter.
 11 24 Records provided by an insurer under this chapter shall be
 11 25 deemed evidence of insurance and not a guarantee of insurance.
 11 26    Sec. 10.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1,
 11 27 2018.
 11 28                           EXPLANATION
 11 29 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 11 30 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 11 31    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
 11 32 program to be administered by the department of transportation
 11 33 (DOT).  Following the applicable competitive bidding
 11 34 procedures, the DOT is required to contract with a third
 11 35 party for four years to act as the DOT's designated agent for
 12  1 administration of the program.
 12  2    The bill provides that a peace officer shall not stop or
 12  3 detain a person solely for a suspected violation of motor
 12  4 vehicle financial liability coverage requirements, and that
 12  5 such requirements are enforceable by a peace officer only as
 12  6 a secondary action when the driver of the vehicle has been
 12  7 stopped or detained for a suspected violation of another
 12  8 provision of  law. The bill prohibits the state or a political
 12  9 subdivision of the state from using any automated or remote
 12 10 system equipped with a camera or other optical device to
 12 11 identify persons operating a motor vehicle in violation of
 12 12 motor vehicle financial liability coverage requirements.
 12 13    The bill requires the DOT to establish an advisory council
 12 14 to make recommendations to the DOT on the best methods and
 12 15 practices for implementing a real=time internet services model
 12 16 for insurance verification, to assist in the development of
 12 17 a guide for insurers detailing the data fields and other
 12 18 information necessary for compliance with the bill, and to
 12 19 provide an annual report to the DOT detailing the improvements
 12 20 and implementation efforts relating to insurance verification
 12 21 in other states for consideration in improving compliance and
 12 22 operations in this state.
 12 23    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain a
 12 24 database containing information from insurers relating to motor
 12 25 vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles, motor
 12 26 vehicle identification information, personal identification
 12 27 information for registered owners of motor vehicles, and any
 12 28 other information provided to the designated agent by the DOT.
 12 29 At least twice per month, the designated agent must update the
 12 30 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 12 31 updated insurance information.  If records in the database
 12 32 indicate that a registered motor vehicle is not covered under
 12 33 an owner's policy of liability insurance, the bill requires the
 12 34 designated agent to use a real=time internet services model
 12 35 to determine if the registered motor vehicle is covered under
 13  1 an owner's policy of liability insurance. The files in the
 13  2 database must be archived semiannually and audited by the DOT
 13  3 at least annually.
 13  4    If database records and the real=time internet services
 13  5 model show that a registered motor vehicle is not covered under
 13  6 an owner's policy of liability insurance for three consecutive
 13  7 months, the designated agent is required to send a notice to
 13  8 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 13  9 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 13 10 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 13 11 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 13 12 notice must be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 13 13 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration must
 13 14 be revoked by the DOT and the owner is required to surrender
 13 15 the registration plates and registration receipt for the
 13 16 vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a new
 13 17 registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 13 18 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 13 19 fee of $100. The fees collected are to be used by the DOT
 13 20 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program,
 13 21 including payments made to the designated agent.
 13 22    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 13 23 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 13 24 policy, or if a real=time internet services model indicates a
 13 25 vehicle is appropriately insured, that fact shall be noted in
 13 26 the database.
 13 27    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 13 28 fraudulent information to the DOT or the DOT's designated
 13 29 agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance verification
 13 30 program.  A violation of this provision is a simple
 13 31 misdemeanor.
 13 32    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy to the
 13 33 owner of a motor vehicle that includes motor vehicle liability
 13 34 coverage, uninsured motorist coverage, underinsured motorist
 13 35 coverage, or personal injury coverage to, before the 7th and
 14  1 the 21st of each month, provide the DOT's designated agent with
 14  2 a record of each motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the
 14  3 insurer and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in
 14  4 the state as of the date of the previous submission. Vehicles
 14  5 subject to apportioned registration under Code chapter 326 are
 14  6 not included in this requirement.  Insurers that fail to comply
 14  7 with the reporting requirement may be assessed a civil penalty
 14  8 of $250 per day.  However, the DOT may waive the penalty upon a
 14  9 showing that the failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the
 14 10 result of excusable neglect. An insurer that discloses records
 14 11 to the DOT's designated agent in a reasonable, good=faith
 14 12 effort to comply with the bill is not subject to the penalty.
 14 13    Information contained in the database is confidential, but
 14 14 the bill provides exceptions for certain disclosures, including
 14 15 disclosures to state or local government agencies and courts
 14 16 for specified purposes, to individuals and certain other
 14 17 authorized persons, for purposes of an accident investigation,
 14 18 to law enforcement agencies and peace officers for certain
 14 19 official purposes, to the state auditor, and to financial
 14 20 institutions with a security interest in a motor vehicle.
 14 21 The designated agent may be authorized by the DOT to provide
 14 22 certified copies or electronic records, as appropriate, and to
 14 23 charge a fee for the provision of records and authentication
 14 24 of documents.
 14 25    A person, including the designated agent, who knowingly
 14 26 releases or discloses information from the database for a
 14 27 purpose other than those authorized in the bill or to a person
 14 28 who is not entitled to such information is guilty of a class
 14 29 "D" felony.
 14 30    The bill provides that the state and the DOT's designated
 14 31 agent are not liable to any person for gathering, managing, or
 14 32 using the information in the database in compliance with the
 14 33 bill. The bill further provides that the designated agent is
 14 34 responsible for maintaining and securing the information in the
 14 35 database provided by the DOT and insurers, and insurers acting
 15  1 in compliance with the bill are not liable to any person for
 15  2 the disclosure of information supplied to the DOT or designated
 15  3 agent. The bill requires the designated agent to indemnify
 15  4 an insurer against any loss arising from the disclosure of
 15  5 information supplied to the DOT or designated agent, provided
 15  6 the insurer supplied the information to the DOT or designated
 15  7 agent in a manner that complies with the bill.
 15  8    The bill takes effect July 1, 2018.

  9 35 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
 10  1 request is made.
 10  2    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
 10  3 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
 10  4 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
 10  5 to access to accident reports.
 10  6    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
 10  7 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
 10  8 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
 10  9 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
 10 10 enforcement agencies.
 10 11    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
 10 12 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
 10 13 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
 10 14 information contained in the database.
 10 15    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
 10 16 of the program.
 10 17    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
 10 18 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
 10 19 interest in a motor vehicle.
 10 20    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
 10 21 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
 10 22 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
 10 23 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
 10 24    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
 10 25 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
 10 26    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
 10 27 another electronic medium if the department determines that
 10 28 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
 10 29 section.
 10 30    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
 10 31 fee established by the department for each of the following:
 10 32    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
 10 33 delivery of a certified copy.
 10 34    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
 10 35 another electronic medium.
 11  1    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
 11  2 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
 11  3    3.  The designated agent or any other person who knowingly
 11  4 releases or discloses information from the database for a
 11  5 purpose other than those authorized in this section or to a
 11  6 person who is not entitled to such information is guilty of a
 11  7 class "D" felony.
 11  8    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
 11  9 shall be liable to any person for gathering, managing, or
 11 10 using the information in the database in compliance with this
 11 11 chapter.
 11 12    5.  The designated agent shall be responsible for
 11 13 maintaining and securing the information in the database
 11 14 provided by the department and insurers under sections 321B.3
 11 15 and 321B.5.
 11 16    6.  An insurer acting in compliance with this chapter shall
 11 17 not be liable to any person for the disclosure of information
 11 18 supplied to the department or designated agent. The designated
 11 19 agent shall indemnify an insurer against any loss arising from
 11 20 the disclosure of information supplied to the department or
 11 21 designated agent, provided the insurer supplied the information
 11 22 to the department or designated agent in a manner that complies
 11 23 with this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to this chapter.
 11 24 Records provided by an insurer under this chapter shall be
 11 25 deemed evidence of insurance and not a guarantee of insurance.
 11 26    Sec. 10.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1,
 11 27 2018.
 11 28                           EXPLANATION
 11 29 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 11 30 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 11 31    This bill establishes a motor vehicle insurance verification
 11 32 program to be administered by the department of transportation
 11 33 (DOT).  Following the applicable competitive bidding
 11 34 procedures, the DOT is required to contract with a third
 11 35 party for four years to act as the DOT's designated agent for
 12  1 administration of the program.
 12  2    The bill provides that a peace officer shall not stop or
 12  3 detain a person solely for a suspected violation of motor
 12  4 vehicle financial liability coverage requirements, and that
 12  5 such requirements are enforceable by a peace officer only as
 12  6 a secondary action when the driver of the vehicle has been
 12  7 stopped or detained for a suspected violation of another
 12  8 provision of  law. The bill prohibits the state or a political
 12  9 subdivision of the state from using any automated or remote
 12 10 system equipped with a camera or other optical device to
 12 11 identify persons operating a motor vehicle in violation of
 12 12 motor vehicle financial liability coverage requirements.
 12 13    The bill requires the DOT to establish an advisory council
 12 14 to make recommendations to the DOT on the best methods and
 12 15 practices for implementing a real=time internet services model
 12 16 for insurance verification, to assist in the development of
 12 17 a guide for insurers detailing the data fields and other
 12 18 information necessary for compliance with the bill, and to
 12 19 provide an annual report to the DOT detailing the improvements
 12 20 and implementation efforts relating to insurance verification
 12 21 in other states for consideration in improving compliance and
 12 22 operations in this state.
 12 23    The designated agent is required to establish and maintain a
 12 24 database containing information from insurers relating to motor
 12 25 vehicle insurance coverage for registered motor vehicles, motor
 12 26 vehicle identification information, personal identification
 12 27 information for registered owners of motor vehicles, and any
 12 28 other information provided to the designated agent by the DOT.
 12 29 At least twice per month, the designated agent must update the
 12 30 database and compare current motor vehicle registrations with
 12 31 updated insurance information.  If records in the database
 12 32 indicate that a registered motor vehicle is not covered under
 12 33 an owner's policy of liability insurance, the bill requires the
 12 34 designated agent to use a real=time internet services model
 12 35 to determine if the registered motor vehicle is covered under
 13  1 an owner's policy of liability insurance. The files in the
 13  2 database must be archived semiannually and audited by the DOT
 13  3 at least annually.
 13  4    If database records and the real=time internet services
 13  5 model show that a registered motor vehicle is not covered under
 13  6 an owner's policy of liability insurance for three consecutive
 13  7 months, the designated agent is required to send a notice to
 13  8 the owner requiring the owner to respond within 15 days by
 13  9 providing proof of financial liability coverage or proof that
 13 10 the owner is exempt from the requirement to maintain financial
 13 11 liability coverage.  If the owner fails to respond, a second
 13 12 notice must be sent.  If the owner does not respond to the
 13 13 second notice, the owner's motor vehicle registration must
 13 14 be revoked by the DOT and the owner is required to surrender
 13 15 the registration plates and registration receipt for the
 13 16 vehicle to the county treasurer.  In order to obtain a new
 13 17 registration for the vehicle, the owner must comply with
 13 18 financial responsibility requirements and pay an administrative
 13 19 fee of $100. The fees collected are to be used by the DOT
 13 20 exclusively to offset the costs of administering the program,
 13 21 including payments made to the designated agent.
 13 22    The bill provides that if a motor vehicle is covered by a
 13 23 form of financial liability coverage other than an insurance
 13 24 policy, or if a real=time internet services model indicates a
 13 25 vehicle is appropriately insured, that fact shall be noted in
 13 26 the database.
 13 27    The bill prohibits a person from providing false or
 13 28 fraudulent information to the DOT or the DOT's designated
 13 29 agent in relation to the motor vehicle insurance verification
 13 30 program.  A violation of this provision is a simple
 13 31 misdemeanor.
 13 32    The bill requires each insurer that issues a policy to the
 13 33 owner of a motor vehicle that includes motor vehicle liability
 13 34 coverage, uninsured motorist coverage, underinsured motorist
 13 35 coverage, or personal injury coverage to, before the 7th and
 14  1 the 21st of each month, provide the DOT's designated agent with
 14  2 a record of each motor vehicle insurance policy issued by the
 14  3 insurer and in effect for vehicles registered or garaged in
 14  4 the state as of the date of the previous submission. Vehicles
 14  5 subject to apportioned registration under Code chapter 326 are
 14  6 not included in this requirement.  Insurers that fail to comply
 14  7 with the reporting requirement may be assessed a civil penalty
 14  8 of $250 per day.  However, the DOT may waive the penalty upon a
 14  9 showing that the failure was inadvertent, accidental, or the
 14 10 result of excusable neglect. An insurer that discloses records
 14 11 to the DOT's designated agent in a reasonable, good=faith
 14 12 effort to comply with the bill is not subject to the penalty.
 14 13    Information contained in the database is confidential, but
 14 14 the bill provides exceptions for certain disclosures, including
 14 15 disclosures to state or local government agencies and courts
 14 16 for specified purposes, to individuals and certain other
 14 17 authorized persons, for purposes of an accident investigation,
 14 18 to law enforcement agencies and peace officers for certain
 14 19 official purposes, to the state auditor, and to financial
 14 20 institutions with a security interest in a motor vehicle.
 14 21 The designated agent may be authorized by the DOT to provide
 14 22 certified copies or electronic records, as appropriate, and to
 14 23 charge a fee for the provision of records and authentication
 14 24 of documents.
 14 25    A person, including the designated agent, who knowingly
 14 26 releases or discloses information from the database for a
 14 27 purpose other than those authorized in the bill or to a person
 14 28 who is not entitled to such information is guilty of a class
 14 29 "D" felony.
 14 30    The bill provides that the state and the DOT's designated
 14 31 agent are not liable to any person for gathering, managing, or
 14 32 using the information in the database in compliance with the
 14 33 bill. The bill further provides that the designated agent is
 14 34 responsible for maintaining and securing the information in the
 14 35 database provided by the DOT and insurers, and insurers acting
 15  1 in compliance with the bill are not liable to any person for
 15  2 the disclosure of information supplied to the DOT or designated
 15  3 agent. The bill requires the designated agent to indemnify
 15  4 an insurer against any loss arising from the disclosure of
 15  5 information supplied to the DOT or designated agent, provided
 15  6 the insurer supplied the information to the DOT or designated
 15  7 agent in a manner that complies with the bill.
 15  8    The bill takes effect July 1, 2018.
       LSB 1761HV (2) 87
       ns/nh
  9  5 confidential and subject to the provisions and penalties of 18
  9  6 U.S.C. {2721.  Such information may not be disclosed, except
  9  7 as follows:
  9  8    a.  For the purpose of investigating, litigating, or
  9  9 enforcing the financial liability coverage requirements
  9 10 of section 321.20B, the designated agent shall provide an
  9 11 electronic record to a state or local government agency or
  9 12 court verifying motor vehicle financial liability coverage
  9 13 information.
  9 14    b.  For the purpose of investigating, litigating, or
  9 15 enforcing the financial liability coverage requirements of
  9 16 section 321.20B, the designated agent shall, upon request,
  9 17 issue to any state or local government agency or court a
  9 18 certificate documenting motor vehicle financial liability
  9 19 coverage, according to the database, of a specific individual
  9 20 or motor vehicle for the time period designated by the
  9 21 government agency or court.
  9 22    c.  Upon request, the department or its designated agent
  9 23 shall disclose whether an individual is covered under a motor
  9 24 vehicle insurance policy, proof of the insurance coverage
  9 25 policy, and the insurance company name to:
  9 26    (1)  The individual or, if the individual is deceased,
  9 27 any person who is an interested party in the estate of the
  9 28 individual as provided under chapter 633.
  9 29    (2)  The parent or legal guardian of the individual if the
  9 30 individual is an unemancipated minor.
  9 31    (3)  The legal guardian of the individual if the individual
  9 32 is legally incapacitated.
  9 33    (4)  A person who has power of attorney for the individual.
  9 34    (5)  A person who submits a notarized release from the
  9 35 individual dated no more than ninety days before the date the
 10  1 request is made.
 10  2    (6)  A person suffering loss or injury in a motor vehicle
 10  3 accident in which the individual was involved, but only as part
 10  4 of an accident report as authorized in section 321.271 relating
 10  5 to access to accident reports.
 10  6    d.  For the purpose of investigating, enforcing, or
 10  7 prosecuting laws or issuing citations, information related to a
 10  8 motor vehicle owner or operator's financial liability coverage
 10  9 under section 321.20B may be provided to state or local law
 10 10 enforcement agencies.
 10 11    e.  Upon request of a peace officer acting in an official
 10 12 capacity under the provisions of paragraph "d", the department
 10 13 or the designated agent shall, upon request, disclose relevant
 10 14 information contained in the database.
 10 15    f.  For the purpose of the state auditor conducting audits
 10 16 of the program.
 10 17    g.  Upon request of a financial institution for the purpose
 10 18 of protecting the financial institution's bona fide security
 10 19 interest in a motor vehicle.
 10 20    2.  a.  The department may allow the designated agent to
 10 21 prepare and deliver, upon request, a report on the insurance
 10 22 information of a person or motor vehicle in accordance with
 10 23 this section.  The report may be in the form of:
 10 24    (1)  A certified copy that is considered admissible in any
 10 25 court proceeding in the same manner as the original.
 10 26    (2)  Information accessible through the internet or through
 10 27 another electronic medium if the department determines that
 10 28 sufficient security is provided to ensure compliance with this
 10 29 section.
 10 30    b.  The department may allow the designated agent to charge a
 10 31 fee established by the department for each of the following:
 10 32    (1)  Authenticating a document, including preparation and
 10 33 delivery of a certified copy.
 10 34    (2)  Accessing a record through the internet or through
 10 35 another electronic medium.
 11  1    (3)  Providing a record to a financial institution under
 11  2 subsection 1, paragraph "g".
 11  3    3.  The designated agent or any other person who knowingly
 11  4 releases or discloses information from the database for a
 11  5 purpose other than those authorized in this section or to a
 11  6 person who is not entitled to such information is guilty of a
 11  7 class "D" felony.
 11  8    4.  Neither the state nor the department's designated agent
 11  9 shall be liable to any person for gathering, managing, or
 11 10 using the information in the database in compliance with this
 11 11 chapter.
 11 12    5.  The designated agent shall be responsible for
 11 13 maintaining and securing the information in the database
 11 14 provided by the department and insurers under sections 321B.3
 11 15 and 321B.5.
 11 16    6.  An insurer acting in compliance with this chapter shall
 11 17 not be liable to any person for the disclosure of information
 11 18 supplied to the department or designated agent. The designated
 11 19 agent shall indemnify an insurer against any loss arising from
 11 20 the disclosure of information supplied to the department or
 11 21 designated agent, provided the insurer supplied the information
 11 22 to the department or designated agent in a manner that complies
 11 23 with this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to this chapter.
 11 24 Records provided by an insurer under this chapter shall be
 11 25 deemed evidence of insurance and not a guarantee of insurance.
 11 26    Sec. 10.  EFFECTIVE DATE.  This Act takes effect July 1,
 11 27 2018.
